result.execSummary:
The defendant George Joseph Bruette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Burnett County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
All payments are ordered to be paid to the BURNETT COUNTY CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE.   Defendant to pay at the rate of $75 per month.  Make checks or money orders payable to "BURNETT COUNTY" and send to: Burnett County Clerk of Court, 7410 Cty. Rd. K,  #115, Siren, WI 54872.    

Payments may be made either in person, by mail, or online either through wicourts.gov or through paygov.us. (subject to each website's processing fees).

The defendant must provide DNA to the Burnett County Sheriff's Department within six months from the sentencing date, and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.  

The defendant shall contact the Burnett County Sheriff's Department and submit to booking and fingerprinting within six months from the sentencing date.

defendant.name: Bruette, George Joseph
defendant.address: 524 SE Bass Lake Rd, Gillett, WI 54124

records.addlTxt:
10:03 AM Defendant, George Joseph Bruette, appeared by telephone.  Atty. Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin.  Case on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.    Mr. Bruette was to call the DA to discuss the case as he was self-represented but was unable to due to phone issues.  The DA makes offer on record to amend to misd. THC, will dismiss paraphernalia.  Mr. Bruette will agree to that offer.  DA makes formal motion to amend.  Court grants amendment.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court advises Defendant of his right to appear in person to make plea.  He waives right to appear in person.  Court asks for plea. 
 Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of  Misd. Possession of THC and orders a JOC.  Other Charge is DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Mr. Bruette asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes  statement to the Court.  Court orders $200 DNA surcharge, must pay $75/mo.  Defendant must provide finger prints and DNA to Sheriff's Dept. within 6 months.  Court provides DNA expungement information.  Appeal rights provided.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

01:36 PM Defendant, George Joseph Bruette, appeared.  Atty. Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin. Def by phone with court approval.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG entered to misdemeanor.  Discussion of counsel.  Def to contact DA.  WTLPH.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
